name: CYSTEINE HYDROCHLORIDE

indications.text: cysteine hydrochloride injection , usp indicated additive amino acids solutions meet nutritional requirements neonates ( preterm term infants less one month age ) requiring total parenteral nutrition .

contraindications.text: • cysteine hydrochloride injection , usp intravenous infusion dilution admixing . ( 2.1 ) • full prescribing information information preparation , , instructions . ( 2.1 , 2.2 , 2.3 , 2.4 ) • recommended neonates based upon recommended daily protein ( amino acid ) requirements : 22 mg cysteine hydrochloride injection , usp/g amino acids . corresponding volume 0.44 ml cysteine hydrochloride injection , usp/g amino acids . ( 2.5 )

warningsAndPrecautions: cysteine hydrochloride injection , usp ( cysteine hydrochloride injection ) clear , colorless , sterile nonpyrogenic solution supplied follows : 500 mg/10 ml ( 50 mg/ml ) cysteine hydrochloride , usp single-dose vials ( ndc 0338-9645-01 ) , packaged 5 vials per carton ( ndc 0338-9645-01 ) store cysteine hydrochloride injection , usp 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) ; excursionspermitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect light . avoid excessive heat . protect freezing . accidentally frozen , discardthe vial . vial stoppers made natural rubber latex . storage admixed solution ( 2.3 )
adverseReactions: cysteine hydrochloride injection , usp contraindicated : •patients known hypersensitivity one amino acids . •patients inborn errors amino acid metabolism due risk severe metabolic neurologic complications . •patients pulmonary edema acidosis due low cardiac output .
indications_original: Cysteine hydrochloride injection, USP is indicated for use as an additive to amino acids solutions to meet nutritional requirements of neonates (preterm and term infants less than one month of age) requiring total parenteral nutrition.
contraindications_original: • Cysteine hydrochloride injection, USP is for intravenous infusion after dilution and admixing only. ( 2.1 ) • See full prescribing information for information on preparation, administration, and instructions for use. ( 2.1 , 2.2 , 2.3 , 2.4 ) • The recommended dosage in neonates is based upon the recommended daily protein (amino acid) requirements:  22 mg cysteine hydrochloride injection, USP/g amino acids.  The corresponding volume is 0.44 mL cysteine hydrochloride injection, USP/g amino acids. ( 2.5 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Cysteine hydrochloride injection, USP (cysteine hydrochloride injection) is a clear, colorless, sterile and nonpyrogenic solution supplied as follows:
                  500 mg/10 mL (50 mg/mL) of cysteine hydrochloride, USP in single-dose vials (NDC  0338-9645-01), packaged as 5 vials per carton (NDC 0338-9645-01)
                  Store cysteine hydrochloride injection, USP at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursionspermitted to 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Protect from light. Avoid excessive heat.  Protect from freezing.  If accidentally frozen, discardthe vial.
                  Vial stoppers are not made with natural rubber latex.
                  For storage of admixed solution see Dosage and Administration (2.3)
adverseReactions_original:
Cysteine hydrochloride injection, USP is contraindicated in:
                  
                     
                        •Patients with known hypersensitivity to one or more amino acids.
                     
                        •Patients with inborn errors of amino acid metabolism due to risk of severe metabolic or neurologic complications.
                     
                        •Patients with pulmonary edema or acidosis due to low cardiac output.
